metadata.title: CVE-2019-13917 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Exim 4.85 through 4.92 (fixed in 4.92.1) allows remote code execution asroot in some unusual configurations that use the ${sort } expansion foritems that can be controlled by an attacker (e.g., $local_part or $domain).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13917` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.3
exim4-base - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.3
exim4-config - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.3
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.3
exim4-daemon-light - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.3
eximon4 - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exim4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.90.1-1ubuntu1.3').
